image.altText: A woman enters a train.

props.synopsis: Can trains help fix South Australia's long-term housing crisis? Labor is looking at a major rail revamp to improve services and get people out of their cars and onto the train network.

title.children: South Australian government explores reopening old rail lines to help keep city connected

image.altText: A little penguin in a ceramic burrow

props.synopsis: The number of little penguins on Kangaroo Island has dropped by more than 70 per cent since 2011, but there's hope that work to rid the island of cats will help their fortunes.

title.children: Some of Australia's best-known little penguin colonies are in sharp decline, survey reveals

image.altText: An aerial image of bushland with the faces of Greg Lynn, Carol Clay and Russell Hill on top.

props.synopsis: A camping trip brought Carol Clay and Russell Hill to a remote pocket of Victoria — but the pair would never emerge from the Wonnangatta Valley.

title.children: Two deaths in the bush and a 'despicable' cover-up — inside the Greg Lynn murder trial

image.altText: A man in a black jumper stands over another man in a white t-shirt.

props.synopsis: A hotel patron who delivered a single blow on a man at a Yorke Peninsula pub on AFL Grand Final Day, has been jailed for the "inherently dangerous" assault, which left the victim suffering a traumatic brain injury and unable to live independently.

title.children: 'Unconscious on his feet': Single punch attacker jailed for pub assault

image.altText: Houses and construction material on the ground viewed through ripped packaging

props.synopsis: Average SA household water bills will increase by $80 each year to help pay for $1.5 billion worth of new mains water and sewerage connections to rapidly growing Adelaide suburbs.

title.children: Water bills to jump by $80 a year as SA premier says future generations will 'wear a bit of debt'

image.altText: Entrance of a shopping centre with sign that reads Armada Arndale

props.synopsis: Police say they were called to an Adelaide shopping centre after reports a group of youths were threatening a man. Six teenagers have been arrested and charged with aggravated affray.

title.children: Rock-throwing, knife-yielding teens arrested in Adelaide, police say

image.altText: Three men sitting in the back of a car, talking

props.synopsis: Julian Assange's long-running legal odyssey has moved around the world, but its last stop looks set to be a courtroom on a small island in the middle of the Pacific Ocean.

title.children: Julian Assange arrives on tiny Pacific island for the court hearing that should set him free

image.altText: Julian Assange looking out of a plane window.

props.synopsis: After years behind bars Julian Assange will face court in a US territory in the Pacific today but it isn't a total surprise.

title.children: An 'irritant' in the Australia-US relationship, Julian Assange will now face court — how did this happen?

image.altText: A young basketballer spins a ball on his finger.

props.synopsis: Late last year, CJ Bruton was sacked as coach of the Adelaide 36ers after a run of poor form — but that experience has in no way dampened 17-year-old Rio's love of the club, with the youngster among a batch of players seeking a spot on the development roster.

title.children: Sacked coach's son in tryouts for NBL club, as young hopefuls shoot for basketball futures

image.altText: A shadowy outline holds a vape to their mouth.

props.synopsis: People who vape will almost certainly be sent into the black market by planned restrictions to ban vape sales outside of pharmacies, say crime experts — especially if legal vapes cost more.

title.children: Vapers will be pushed into black market by vape sales ban, crime experts warn

image.altText: a woman holds a vape as she blows smoke out of her mouth while walking outdoors

props.synopsis: The Coalition has been ruminating internally over how to handle the government's impending vape ban. Who would have thought they would land on option two: inhale, reverse the ban, bring in a new tax and declare war on organised crime.

title.children: With a puff of smoke, it's on like Donkey Kong: Dutton taps in to the vape wars

image.altText: A man in a wheelchair holding a cane next to someone walking and wearing jeans.

props.synopsis: They're also frustrated with the recommendations of the government-led Senate inquiry into the legislation describing them as "profoundly disappointing and disrespectful".

title.children: Disability groups urge government to make significant changes to NDIS bill amid fears it will have negative impact

image.altText: Two women in olive green uniforms and safety goggles stand next to a large crate of golden bullet shells in a factory setting.

props.synopsis: The auditor-general has revealed a Defence employee also gave confidential information to the foreign-owned defence contractor ahead of the lucrative deal, and then joined the business after it was awarded the contract.

title.children: Defence official sought champagne from French company during $1.2 billion munitions contract discussions

image.altText: A man in a suit speaks into a microphone.

props.synopsis: It can be hard to get a handle on Robert F Kennedy Jr, the nephew of JFK, but one thing's for sure: his bid for the White House can't be easily dismissed.

title.children: A brain worm, pet ravens and vaccine conspiracies: Who is the independent candidate shaking up the US election?

image.altText: a house for sale in the brisbane suburb of stafford with the sale sign in the front yard

props.synopsis: Australian property resales reached their highest rate of profitability since July 2010 in the first quarter of the year, according to a new report from CoreLogic.

title.children: Homeowners selling up and making hundreds of thousands of dollars

image.altText: A man with tattoos on his arms, chest and neck poses for a photo, wearing a black tank top and a hat

props.synopsis: Shifty Shellshock, the frontman of American rap rock band Crazy Town, has died at his home aged 49.

title.children: Shifty Shellshock, singer of Crazy Town and 00s hit Butterfly, dies at 49

image.altText: Julian Assange greets supporters outside the Ecuadorian embassy in London.

props.synopsis: Julian Assange may finally be out, but his case has undeniably had a serious chilling effect on public interest journalism, and sends a terrifying message to any sources sitting on evidence of abuses by the government and its agencies.

title.children: Assange may be free, but his case has had a serious chilling effect on public interest journalism and sends a terrifying message

image.altText: A man in black and white in front of a background of vapes.

props.synopsis: Luke Walles says sometimes he feels better smoking a cigarette than vaping. For health experts, that's a problem.

title.children: Some young people hooked on vapes are turning to another alternative — cigarettes

image.altText: A crowd of people walking in a city with high rise buildings in the background on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: If inflation keeps sinking when the official quarterly figures are released next month, it'll be doubly good news for stretched households. It'll mean slower price rises, and probably an end to talk of further interest rate rises.

title.children: Many of us are feeling the pinch, but the economy is doing better than predicted — and the future is looking up

image.altText: An illustration of a wind farm and a solar farm with an hour glass in the middle.

props.synopsis: With big wind and solar projects stalling, the energy market operator forecasts that Australian households will continue to do the heavy lifting in the renewables transition, with four out of five homes to have rooftop solar by 2050.

title.children: With big wind and solar projects stalling, the market operator suggests rooftop solar will continue to do the heavy lifting

image.altText: An aerial shot showing a person down a hole with firefighters surrounding the hole.

props.synopsis: A man is rescued after becoming trapped in a hole at a property in Perth's northern suburbs for more than three hours.

title.children: Man trapped in backyard hole freed after 'delicate' three-hour rescue operation

image.altText: Woman staring at camera, in front of a picture frames on a wall

props.synopsis: Donna Thurnell says apprehended violence orders mean "absolutely nothing", and says the system failed her daughter.

title.children: Kristy Armstrong was murdered by her ex-husband. Her mother says an AVO 'didn't work'

image.altText: An older woman in a pink puffer jacket, smiling.

props.synopsis: Could a cap-and-trade system help address the chronic housing shortages in popular tourist destinations around Australia?

title.children: The wicked problem plaguing the world's most beautiful places might have a solution.

image.altText: an aerial photo of floodplains and green grass.

props.synopsis: The new owners of Woolner Station have spent more than $200 million buying seven NT cattle stations since 2018.

title.children: $49 million Darwin floodplain property sale brings owner's beef export ambitions closer to reality

image.altText: Young smiling woman with long dark hair pulled back, holding a baby, whose face is blurred. both wearing brown, mustard clothes

props.synopsis: The missing woman's great-aunt Stella Nealon told the court that alleged murderer Anne Geeves was "nasty" to Ms Haigh and threatened to "take" her baby, during a disjointed day at court.

title.children: Accused killer Anne Geeves would watch Amber Haigh have sex with husband, court hears

image.altText: A man looks serious, standing in front of shelves stocked with vapes.

props.synopsis: Vaping businesses say they have been left in the lurch by a vape sales ban due to pass parliament and begin on Monday. They warn the closure of their businesses will push more people into the black market.

title.children: 'I'm pissed off': Vape shop owners brace for the end to their businesses, and an uncertain future

image.altText: Payman walks across the senate.

props.synopsis: Labor senator Fatima Payman has crossed the floor to vote against her party on a motion related to Palestinian recognition.

title.children: Labor senator could remain in party despite defiance on Palestinian recognition

image.altText: Terri and Bindi Irwin stand with their arms around each other while Robert Irwin stands on a large rock behind them

props.synopsis: Bindi Irwin's joyous Tasmanian family holiday photos were sure to be on the radar of US celebrity watching media — the trouble is, they don't seem to know the difference between Tasmania and Tanzania, locations which are more than 11,000 kilometres apart.

title.children: Bindi blunder by US celebrity website mistaking Tasmania for Tanzania

image.altText: A baby diprotodon at the water's edge.

props.synopsis: Towering birds, terrifying lizards and massive marsupials once roamed Australia. How much do you know about our mega-sized past?

title.children: Think you know your diprotodon from your procoptodon? Take our mega megafauna quiz to find out

image.altText: A man grimaces with his mouth as he stares straight ahead

props.synopsis: The NSW Office of the Director of Public Prosecutions (ODPP) said it had reached its determination after "having carefully considered the many competing factors".

title.children: Jarryd Hayne will not face a fourth trial over sexual assault allegations, DPP confirms

image.altText: Thousands of people march in the street in a protest

props.synopsis: Contentious tax changes sparked protests across Kenya, with demonstrations turning deadly in the capital Nairobi.

title.children: At least 5 dead after Kenyan parliament overrun by protesters and set ablaze

image.altText: Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu and Chief of the General Staff Valery Gerasimov stand together.

props.synopsis: The court is accusing former defence minister Sergei Shoigu and chief of staff General Valery Gerasimov of war crimes and the crime against humanity of inhumane acts.

title.children: ICC issues arrest warrants for former Russian defence minister and chief of staff

image.altText: A man speaks into a microphone at a rally in a UK park.

props.synopsis: Julian Assange's family plan to sit back and have some beer and champagne should all go to plan and he is soon back in Australia.

title.children: Julian Assange knew 'for weeks' he was being released from UK prison

image.altText: Robert Trott outside a court in Timor Leste.

props.synopsis: A Timor Leste court sentences Australian man Robert Trott to 11 years in jail after he was convicted of abusing a girl under the age of 12.

title.children: Australian man sentenced to 11 years prison in Timor Leste for child sex abuse

image.altText: A shirtless man with white hair and a white beard is surrounded by a rescue team.

props.synopsis: The 34-year-old hiker has been found after 10 days in the Northern California mountains, where he survived by collecting water in his shoe.

title.children: Lukas McClish got lost in the Northern California mountains. He survived by collecting water in his shoe
